A cloth was brought and privacy was provided for him (the Holy Prophet). He took a bath and then stood up and observed eight rak'ahs. I do not know whether his Qiyam (standing posture) was longer, or bending or prostration or all of them were of equal duration. She (Umm Hani) further said: I never saw him saying this Nafl prayer prior to it or subsequently. (Al-Muradi narrated on the authority of Yunus that he made no mention of the words:" He informed me." )
question: What can be learned from Umm Hani's narration about the Prophet's prayer habits?

hadith-eng: The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) used to observe two rak'ahs of Sunnah (prayer) when he heard the Adhin and shortened them.
question: What can be learned about the timing and length of Sunnah prayers from the Prophet's (ﷺ) practice?

hadith-eng: He who observed twelve voluntary rak'ahs, a house will be built for him in Paradise.
question: What are the rewards associated with observing voluntary prayers in Islam?

hadith-eng: I asked 'A'isha about the prayer of the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ). She said: The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) would observe prayer (Nafl) in a standing position as well as in a sitting position, and when he commenced the prayer in a standing position, he bowed in this very position, and when he commenced the prayer in a sitting position, he bowed in this very position.
question: How does the flexibility in prayer positions reflect the Prophet's approach to worship?

hadith-eng: The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) used to recite in sitting position (while observing the Tahajjud prayer) and when he intended to bow, he would stand up and recite (for the duration in which) a man (ordinarily) recites forty verses.
question: What can be learned about the Prophet's (ﷺ) practice of Tahajjud prayer from this narration?

hadith-eng: When the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) grew bulky and heavy he would observe (most of his Nafl) prayers sitting.
question: How does the practice of sitting during Nafl prayers reflect the principles of ease and accommodation in Islamic worship?

hadith-eng: I asked Anas b. Malik about shortening of prayer. He said: When the Messenger of' Allah (ﷺ) had covered a distance of three miles or three farsakh (Shu'ba, one of the narrators, had some doubt about it) he observed two rak'ahs.
question: How did the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) practice shortening of prayers during his travels?

hadith-eng: When you have announced" I testify that there is no god but Allah; I testify that Muhammad is the Messenger of Allah," do not say:" Come to the prayer," but make this announcement:" Say prayer in your houses." He (the narrator) said that the people disapproved of it. Ibn 'Abbas said: Are you astonished at it? He (the Holy Prophet), who is better than I, did it. Jumu'a prayer is no doubt obligatory, but I do not like that I should (force you) to come out and walk in mud and slippery ground.
question: What is the significance of the flexibility in the call to prayer during challenging weather conditions?

hadith-eng: We met Anas b. Malik as he came to Syria at a place known as 'Ain-al-Tamar and saw him observing prayer on the back of his donkey with his face turned in that direction. (Hammam one of the narrators) pointed towards the left of Qibla, so I said to him: I find you observing prayer towards the side other than that of Qibla. Upon this he said: Had I not seen the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) doing like this, I would not have done so at all.
question: What can be learned from the companions' adherence to the practices they observed from the Prophet (ﷺ)?

hadith-eng: I asked Anas how I should turn-to the right or to the left-when I say my prayers. He said: I have very often seen the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) turning to the right.
question: What guidance can be derived from the actions of the Prophet (ﷺ) regarding the direction to turn during prayer?

hadith-eng: The dawn prayer had commenced when the Messen- ger of Allah (ﷺ) saw a person observing prayer, whereas the Mu'adhdhin had pronounced the Iqama. Upon this he (the Holy Prophet) remarked: Do you say four (rak'ahs) of Fard in the dawn prayer?
question: What is the prescribed number of rak'ahs for the dawn prayer in Islam?

hadith-eng: The Apostle of Allah (ﷺ) owed me a debt; he paid me back and made an addition (of this). I entered the mosque and he (the Holy Prophet) said to me: Observe two rak'ahs of prayer.
question: What lessons can be learned from the Prophet's (ﷺ) actions regarding financial transactions and prayer?

hadith-eng: I asked 'A'isha whether the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) used to observe the forenoon prayer. She said: No, but when he came back from the journey.
question: How does travel affect the prayer practices of a Muslim according to the Prophet's (ﷺ) example?

hadith-eng: No one has ever narrated to me that he saw the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) observing the forenoon prayer, except Umm Hani. She, however, narrated that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) entered her house on the day of the Conquest of Mecca and prayed eight rak'ahs (adding): I never saw a shorter prayer than it except that he performed the bowing and prostration completely. But (one of the narrators) Ibn Bashshar in his narration made no mention of the word:" Never".
question: What can be inferred about the Prophet's prayer from Umm Hani's narration?

hadith-eng: I went to the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) on the day of the Conquest of Mecca and found him taking a bath, and Fatimah, his daughter, had provided him privacy with the help of a cloth. I gave him salutation and he said: Who is she? I said: It is Umm Hani, daughter of Abu Talib. He (the Holy Prophet) said: Greeting for Umm Hani. When he had completed the bath, he stood up and observed eight rak'ahs wrapped up in one cloth. When he turned back (after the prayer), I said to him: Messenger of Allah, the son of my mother 'Ali b. Abu Talib is going to kill a person, Fulan b. Hubaira whom I have given protection. Upon this the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: We too have given protection whom you have given protection, O Umm Hani. Umm Hani said: It was the forenoon (prayer).
question: What can be learned about the Prophet's (ﷺ) prayer habits from this event?

hadith-eng: " When it was dawn".
question: What is the role of specific times of day in the practice of Islamic prayers or rituals?

hadith-eng: 'A'isha reported that the Apostle (ﷺ) was not so much particular about observing supererogatory rak'ahs as in case of the two rak'ahs of the dawn prayer.
question: How does the emphasis on specific prayers reflect the Prophet's (ﷺ) practice and guidance?

hadith-eng: A house will be built in Paradise, for anyone who prays in a day and a night twelve rak'ahs; and she added: I have never abandoned (observing them) since I heard it from the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ). Some of the other narrators said the same words: I have never abandoned (observing them) since I heard (from so and so).
question: How did the companions and family of the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) demonstrate their commitment to his teachings?

hadith-eng: Never did I see the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) observing supererogatory prayer sitting till one year before his death when he would observe Nafl prayer in a sitting position, and he would recite the Surah (of the Qur'an) in such a slow-measured tone (that duration of its recital) became more lengthy than the one longer than this.
question: What can be learned from the Prophet's (ﷺ) recitation style during prayers in terms of its pace and duration?

hadith-eng: I fell ill and lbn 'Umar came to inquire after my health, and I asked him about the glorification of Allah (i. e. prayer) while travelling. Thereupon he said: I accompanied the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) on a journey but I did not see him glorifying Him, and were I to glorify (Him). I would have completed the prayer. Allah, the Exalted, has said:" Verily there is a model pattern for you in the Messenger of Allah."
question: What can be inferred about the practice of glorification of Allah during travel from the actions of the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ)?

hadith-eng: I heard Anas b. Malik say: We went out for Pilgrimage from Medina. The rest is the same.
question: How did the companions of the Prophet (ﷺ) approach the journey of pilgrimage?

hadith-eng: When you have announced" I testify that there is no god but Allah; I testify that Muhammad is the Messenger of Allah," do not say:" Come to the prayer," but make this announcement:" Say prayer in your houses." He (the narrator) said that the people disapproved of it. Ibn 'Abbas said: Are you astonished at it? He (the Holy Prophet), who is better than I, did it. Jumu'a prayer is no doubt obligatory, but I do not like that I should (force you) to come out and walk in mud and slippery ground.
question: What is the significance of flexibility in religious practices, such as the Jumu'a prayer, during difficult situations?

hadith-eng: I do not like you should walk in muddy slippery place.
question: What guidance is provided for performing prayers at home during inclement weather according to Islamic tradition?

hadith-eng: When the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) set out on a journey before the sun declined (from the meridian), he delayed the noon prayer till the afternoon prayer, and then dismounted (his ride) and combined them (noon and afternoon prayers), but if the sun had declined before his setting out on a journey, he observed the noon prayer and then mounted (the ride).
question: How does the position of the sun influence the timing of prayers for travelers in Islamic tradition?

hadith-eng: A hadith like this has been reported by Ishaq with the same chain of transmitters.
question: Why is it important to have multiple sources for a single hadith in Islamic tradition?

hadith-eng: A hadith like this has been narrated by Abu Huraira by another chain of transmitters.
question: How does the presence of different narrators affect the authenticity of a hadith?

hadith-eng: A house will be built in Paradise, for anyone who prays in a day and a night twelve rak'ahs; and she added: I have never abandoned (observing them) since I heard it from the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ). Some of the other narrators said the same words: I have never abandoned (observing them) since I heard (from so and so).
question: How did the companions of the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) demonstrate their commitment to following his teachings?

hadith-eng: I said to 'A'isha and she made a mention of that (recorded above) about the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ).
question: What role does A'isha play in the transmission of Islamic knowledge and hadiths?

hadith-eng: I went along with Shurahbil b. al-Simt to a village which was situated at a distance of seventeen or eighteen miles, and he said only two rak'ahs of prayer. I said to him (about it) and he said: I saw 'Umar observing two rak'ahs at Dhu'l-Hulaifa and I (too) said to him (about it) and he said: I am doing the same as I saw the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) doing.
question: What is the importance of observing the actions of the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) when traveling?

hadith-eng: Salim b. 'Abdullah (b. 'Umar) reported on the authority of his father that Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) observed the prayer of a traveller, i. e. two rak'ahs in Mina, and other places; so did Abu Bakr and 'Umar, and 'Uthman too observed two rak'ahs at the beginning of his caliphate, but he then completed four.
question: What changes did 'Uthman implement regarding the number of rak'ahs during his caliphate?

hadith-eng: Pray in your dwellings; and then said: When it was a cold, rainy night, the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) used to command the Mu'adhdhin to say" Pray in your dwellings."
question: What instructions did the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) give regarding praying at home during harsh weather?

hadith-eng: A hadith like this that Ibn 'Abbas ordered his Mu'adhdhin (to summon people to prayer and then make announcement to say prayer in their houses) on Friday which was a rainy day, has been transmitted by 'Abdullah b. Harith. Wuhaib, however, says that he did not hear it from him.
question: What are the guidelines for performing prayers at home during challenging weather conditions?

hadith-eng: The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) combined in the expedition to Tabuk the noon prayer with the afternoon prayer and the sunset prayer with the 'Isha' prayer. He (one of the narrators) said: What prompted him to do that? He (Mu'adh) replied that he (the Holy Prophet) wanted that his Ummah should not be put to (unnecessary) hardship.
question: What are the circumstances under which combining prayers is permitted in Islamic teachings?

hadith-eng: A person entered the mosque, while the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) was leading the dawn prayer. He observed two rak'ahs in a corner of the mosque, and then joined the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) in prayer. When the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) had pronounced salutations (he had concluded the prayer), he said: O, so and so, which one out of these two prayers did you count (as your Fard prayer), the one that you observed alone or the prayer that you observed with us?
question: What can be learned about the Prophet's approach to addressing actions during prayer from this narration?

hadith-eng: I went with the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) on an expedition and my camel delayed me and I was exhausted. The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) thus came earlier than I, whereas I came on the next day and went to the mosque and found him (the Holy Prophet) at the gate of the mosque. He said: It is now that you have come. I said. Yes. He said: Leave your camel and enter (the mosque) and observe two rak'ahs. He (the narrator) said: So I entered and observed (two rak'ahs) of prayer and then went back.
question: What actions are recommended when arriving late to a gathering or place of worship in Islam?

hadith-eng: I aksed 'A'isha whether the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) used to observe the forenoon prayer. She said: No, except when he came back from a journey.
question: What can be inferred about the Prophet Muhammad's (ﷺ) routine prayers from his wife's observations?

hadith-eng: Abu Murra narrated on the authority of Umm Hani that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) on the day of the Conquest of Mecca observed in her house eight rak'ahs of prayer in one cloth, its opposite corners having been tied from the opposite sides.
question: What can be learned about the flexibility of prayer attire from the actions of the Prophet (ﷺ)?

hadith-eng: He who observed twelve voluntary rak'ahs, a house will be built for him in Paradise.
question: What rewards are promised for those who consistently perform additional prayers beyond the obligatory ones?

hadith-eng: I asked 'A'isha whether the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) observed (Nafl) sitting. She said: Yes, when the people had made him old.
question: How did the perception of the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) by the people influence his prayer practices?

hadith-eng: A hadith like this has been transmitted by Anas, but no mention has been made of Pilgrimage.
question: Why might different narrators report varying details in hadiths?

hadith-eng: A hadith like this has been reported by Zuhri, with the same chain of transmitters, and in it mention was made of Mina only, but not of other places.
question: What role do transmitters play in the authenticity and transmission of hadiths?

hadith-eng: Pray in your dwellings; and then said: When it was a cold, rainy night, the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) used to command the Mu'adhdhin to say" Pray in your dwellings."
question: What considerations should be taken into account when deciding whether to attend congregational prayers during inclement weather?

hadith-eng: When you have announced" I testify that there is no god but Allah; I testify that Muhammad is the Messenger of Allah," do not say:" Come to the prayer," but make this announcement:" Say prayer in your houses." He (the narrator) said that the people disapproved of it. Ibn 'Abbas said: Are you astonished at it? He (the Holy Prophet), who is better than I, did it. Jumu'a prayer is no doubt obligatory, but I do not like that I should (force you) to come out and walk in mud and slippery ground.
question: What is the significance of the Prophet Muhammad's actions in setting precedents for flexibility in religious practices?

hadith-eng: " I said to Ibn 'Abbas: What prompted him to do that? He said: So that his (Prophet's) Ummah should not be put to (unnecessary) hardship." And in the hadith transmitted by Mu'awiya (the words are):" It was said to Ibn 'Abbas: What did he intend thereby? He said he wanted that his Ummah should not be put to unnecessary hardship."
question: What lessons can be learned from the Prophet's actions regarding flexibility in religious practices to accommodate the needs of the community?

hadith-eng: I observed with the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) eight (rak'ahs) in combination, and seven rak'ahs in combination. I (one of the narrators) said: O Abd Sha'tha', I think that he (the Holy Prophet) had delayed the noon prayer and hastened the afternoon prayer, and he delayed the sunset prayer and hastened the 'Isha' prayer. He said: I also think so.
question: What are the possible reasons for delaying or hastening prayers according to Islamic teachings?

hadith-eng: A hadith like this has been reported by Ishaq with the same chain of transmitters.
question: Why is it important to verify the chain of transmitters in Islamic traditions?

hadith-eng: The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) bought a camel from me. When he came back to Medina, he ordered me to come to the mosque and observed two rak'ahs of prayer.
question: What can be learned from the Prophet's actions regarding the integration of worship and commerce?

hadith-eng: three fasts during every month, two rak'ahs of the forenoon prayer, and observing Witr prayer before going to bed.
question: What is the significance of the Witr prayer in a Muslim's nightly routine?

hadith-eng: I said to 'A'isha and she made a mention of that (recorded above) about the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ).
question: What methods are used to verify the authenticity of narrations about the Prophet (ﷺ)?

hadith-eng: A hadith like this has been reported by Zuhri, with the same chain of transmitters, and in it mention was made of Mina only, but not of other places.
question: Why might certain locations be specifically mentioned in hadith narrations?

hadith-eng: The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said two rak'ahs at Mina, and Abu Bakr after him, and 'Umar after Abu Bakr, and 'Uthman at the beginning of his caliphate; then 'Uthman observed four rak'ahs, and when Ibn 'Umar prayed with the Imam, he said four rak'ahs, but when he observed prayer alone, he said two rak'ahs.
question: What does Ibn 'Umar's practice of varying the number of rak'ahs based on whether he prayed alone or with the Imam indicate about following the Imam in prayer?

hadith-eng: We set cut with the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) on a journey when it began to rain. Upon this he said: He who desires may pray in his dwelling.
question: What considerations are given to travelers in Islam regarding prayer during adverse weather conditions?

hadith-eng: I asked Anas how I should turn-to the right or to the left-when I say my prayers. He said: I have very often seen the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) turning to the right.
question: What can be inferred about the Prophet Muhammad's (ﷺ) prayer habits from the companions' observations?

hadith-eng: When any one of you enters the mosque, he should observe two rak'ahs (of Nafl prayer) before sitting.
question: How does performing Nafl prayers upon entering a mosque reflect on a person's devotion and respect for the place of worship?

hadith-eng: In the morning charity is due from every bone in the body of every one of you. Every utterance of Allah's glorification is an act of charity. Every utterance of praise of Him is an act of charity, every utterance of profession of His Oneness is an act of charity, every utterance of profession of His Greatness is an act of charity, enjoining good is an act of charity, forbidding what is distreputable is an act of charity, and two rak'ahs which one prays in the forenoon will suffice.
question: How does performing two rak'ahs in the forenoon fulfill the obligation of charity?

hadith-eng: Zuhri reported this hadith with the same chain of transmitters, except this that he made a mention of one year or two years.
question: How do differences in narration impact the interpretation of Islamic teachings?

hadith-eng: It was narrated to me that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) had said: The prayer observed by a person sitting is half of the prayer. I came to him (ﷺ) and found him praying in a sitting position. I placed my hand on his head. He said: O 'Abdullah b. 'Amr, what is the matter with you? I said: Messenger of Allah, it has been narrated to me that you said: The prayer of a man in a sitting position is half of the prayer, whereas you are observing prayer sitting. He (the Holy Prophet) said: Yes, it is so, but I am not like anyone amongst you.
question: What are the implications of performing prayer in a sitting position for those who are able to stand?

hadith-eng: I prayed with the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) two rak'ahs and most of them offered two rak'ahs only in Mina, while the people felt secure.
question: What can be learned about the practice of prayer from the actions of the Prophet (ﷺ) in Mina?

hadith-eng: Pray in your dwellings, pray in your dwellings, and then said: When it was a cold night or it was raining in a journey the Messenger of Allah (may peace he upon him) used to command the Mu'adhdhin to announce: Pray in your dwellings.
question: What role does the Mu'adhdhin play in communicating changes to prayer practices during difficult weather?

hadith-eng: We set cut with the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) on a journey when it began to rain. Upon this he said: He who desires may pray in his dwelling.
question: What options are available for Muslims concerning prayer when faced with adverse weather conditions while traveling?

hadith-eng: A hadith like this has been reported by Ishaq with the same chain of transmitters.
question: Why is it important to have multiple narrations of the same hadith in Islamic tradition?

hadith-eng: I entered the mosque, when the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) had been sitting among people, and I also sat down among them. Upon this the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: What prevented you from offering two rak'ahs (of Nafl prayer) before sitting down? I said: Messenger of Allah, I saw you sitting and people sitting (around you and I, therefore, sat in your company). He (the Holy Prophet) then said: When anyone among you enters the mosque, he should not sit till he has observed two rak'ahs.
question: What can be learned about the etiquette of prayer from the actions of the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) in a mosque setting?

hadith-eng: A hadith like this has been narrated by Abu Huraira by another chain of transmitters.
question: How does the presence of multiple narrators affect the authenticity of a hadith?

hadith-eng: A hadith like this has been narrated by the same chain of transmitters.

hadith-eng: I asked Anas how I should turn-to the right or to the left-when I say my prayers. He said: I have very often seen the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) turning to the right.
question: What guidance is provided regarding the direction to face after finishing prayer?

hadith-eng: A person entered the mosque, while the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) was leading the dawn prayer. He observed two rak'ahs in a corner of the mosque, and then joined the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) in prayer. When the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) had pronounced salutations (he had concluded the prayer), he said: O, so and so, which one out of these two prayers did you count (as your Fard prayer), the one that you observed alone or the prayer that you observed with us?
question: What can be learned about the Prophet's (ﷺ) approach to teaching and correcting prayer practices?

hadith-eng: Four rak'ahs, but sometimes more as he pleased.
question: What does the practice of the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) indicate about the forenoon prayer?

hadith-eng: "Say: We believed in Allah and what was revealed to us..." verse 136 from Surah Baqara, and in the second of the two: "I believe in Allah and I bear testimony that we are Muslims" (iii. 52).
question: What is the role of reciting Quranic verses in the practice of supererogatory prayers?

hadith-eng: I did not see the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) reciting (the Qur'an) in the night prayer in a sitting position, till he grew old and then he recited (it) in a sitting position, but when thirty or forty verses were left out of the Surah, he would then stand up, recite them and then bowed.
question: How did the Prophet (ﷺ) incorporate both sitting and standing positions in his night prayer recitation?

hadith-eng: I said to 'A'isha and she made a mention of that (recorded above) about the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ).
question: What can be learned from the interactions between 'Abdullah b. Shaqiq and 'A'isha regarding the Prophet's practices?

question: What significance do the Surahs 'Say: O unbelievers' and 'Say: Allah is one' hold in Islamic prayers?

hadith-eng: I went along with Shurahbil b. al-Simt to a village which was situated at a distance of seventeen or eighteen miles, and he said only two rak'ahs of prayer. I said to him (about it) and he said: I saw 'Umar observing two rak'ahs at Dhu'l-Hulaifa and I (too) said to him (about it) and he said: I am doing the same as I saw the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) doing.
question: What is the importance of observing the actions of the companions of the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) in understanding Islamic rituals?

hadith-eng: We went out from Medina to Mecca with the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) and he prayed two rak'ahs at each time of prayer till we returned to Medina. I said: For how long did he stay in Mecca? He said: (For) ten (days).
question: How long did the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) stay in Mecca during this journey, and what does it indicate about his travel practices?

hadith-eng: I heard 'Abdullah b. al-Harith say: 'Abdullah b. 'Abbas addressed us on a rainy day, and the rest of the hadith is the same, but he made no mention of Jumu'a prayer, and added: He who did it (who commanded us to say prayer in our houses), i. e. the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ), is better than I.
question: What can be learned about the authority and wisdom of the Prophet in guiding the community during unexpected situations?

hadith-eng: Ibn 'Umar reported that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) used to say Nafl prayer on (the back of) his camel in whatever direction it took him.
question: What is the significance of performing Nafl prayers on a camel during a journey?

hadith-eng: I saw the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) praying (Nafl prayer) on a donkey's back while his face was turned towards Khaibar.
question: What can be inferred about the flexibility of prayer positions during travel from this incident?

hadith-eng: Salim b. 'Abdullah reported on the authority of his father that the Messenger of Allah (may peace be. upon him) used to observe Nafl (supererogatory) prayer on his ride no matter in what direction it turned its face, and he observed Witr too on it, but did not observe obligatory prayer on it.
question: How does the practice of praying on a ride reflect the flexibility in Islamic worship during travel?

hadith-eng: " His face would turn towards us."
question: Why is it important to note variations in different narrations of the same hadith?

hadith-eng: When any one of you enters the mosque, he should say:" O Allah! open for me the doors of Thy mercy" ; and when he steps out he should say: 'O Allah! I beg of Thee Thy Grace." (Imam Muslim said: I heard Yahya saying: I transcribed this hadith from the compilation of Sulaiman b. Bilal.)
question: How does entering and exiting the mosque relate to seeking mercy and grace from Allah?

hadith-eng: When the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) intended to combine two prayers on a journey, he delayed the noon prayer till came the early time of the afternoon prayer, and then combined the two.

hadith-eng: None of you should give a share to Satan out of your self. He should not deem that it is necessary for him to turn but to the right only (after prayer). I saw the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) turning to the left.

question: What does this incident teach about the timing and order of performing prayers in Islam?

hadith-eng: A person entered the mosque, while the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) was leading the dawn prayer. He observed two rak'ahs in a corner of the mosque, and then joined the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) in prayer. When the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) had pronounced salutations (he had concluded the prayer), he said: O, so and so, which one out of these two prayers did you count (as your Fard prayer), the one that you observed alone or the prayer that you observed with us?
question: What can be inferred about the Prophet's (ﷺ) approach to addressing prayer-related actions of his companions?

hadith-eng: A hadith like this has been narrated by Abu Huraira by another chain of transmitters.
question: What is the role of Abu Huraira in the transmission of hadiths and why is he a significant figure in Islamic tradition?

hadith-eng: The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) used to recite in sitting position (while observing the Tahajjud prayer) and when he intended to bow, he would stand up and recite (for the duration in which) a man (ordinarily) recites forty verses.
question: What can be learned from the Prophet's method of recitation and movement during Tahajjud prayer regarding the balance between physical posture and spiritual focus?

hadith-eng: I told 'Umar b. al-Khattab that Allah had said:" You may shorten the prayer only if you fear that those who are unbelievers may afflict you" (Qur'an, iv. 101), whereas the people are now safe. question: How did the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) practice combining prayers while traveling?

hadith-eng: I went to the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) on the day of the Conquest of Mecca and found him taking a bath, and Fatimah, his daughter, had provided him privacy with the help of a cloth. I gave him salutation and he said: Who is she? I said: It is Umm Hani, daughter of Abu Talib. He (the Holy Prophet) said: Greeting for Umm Hani. When he had completed the bath, he stood up and observed eight rak'ahs wrapped up in one cloth. When he turned back (after the prayer), I said to him: Messenger of Allah, the son of my mother 'Ali b. Abu Talib is going to kill a person, Fulan b. Hubaira whom I have given protection. Upon this the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: We too have given protection whom you have given protection, O Umm Hani. Umm Hani said: It was the forenoon (prayer).
question: What role did Fatimah play in providing privacy for the Prophet during his bath?

hadith-eng: A hadith like this has been narrated by Shu'ba with the same chain of transmitters.
question: What role does the chain of transmitters play in the classification of a hadith as Sahih?

hadith-eng: A house will be built in Paradise, for anyone who prays in a day and a night twelve rak'ahs; and she added: I have never abandoned (observing them) since I heard it from the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ). hadith-eng: If any Muslim servant (of Allah) prays for the sake of Allah twelve rak'ahs (of Sunan) every day, over and above the obligatory ones, Allah will build for him a house in Paradise, or a house will be built for him in Paradise; and I have not abandoned observing them after (hearing it from the Messenger of Allah). (So said also 'Amr and Nu'man.)
question: What are the benefits of maintaining consistent voluntary prayers according to Islamic teachings?

hadith-eng: 'A'isha reported that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) would pray in the night for a long time, and when he prayed standing be bowed in a standing posture, and when he prayed sitting, he bowed in a sitting posture.
question: What can be learned about the flexibility in prayer positions from the Prophet's (ﷺ) practice?

hadith-eng: I asked 'A'isha whether the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) observed (Nafl) sitting. She said: Yes, when the people had made him old.
question: How did the actions of the people influence the Prophet Muhammad's (ﷺ) prayer practices?

hadith-eng: I said to 'A'isha and she made a mention of that (recorded above) about the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ).
question: What role does 'A'isha play in the transmission of hadiths related to the Prophet's (ﷺ) actions?

hadith-eng: Never did I see the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) observing supererogatory prayer sitting till one year before his death when he would observe Nafl prayer in a sitting position, and he would recite the Surah (of the Qur'an) in such a slow-measured tone (that duration of its recital) became more lengthy than the one longer than this.
question: What can be learned from the Prophet's practice of reciting the Qur'an in a slow-measured tone during prayers?

hadith-eng: I fell ill and lbn 'Umar came to inquire after my health, and I asked him about the glorification of Allah (i. e. prayer) while travelling. Thereupon he said: I accompanied the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) on a journey but I did not see him glorifying Him, and were I to glorify (Him). I would have completed the prayer. Allah, the Exalted, has said:" Verily there is a model pattern for you in the Messenger of Allah."
question: What is the significance of inquiring about religious practices during times of illness or travel?

hadith-eng: I went along with Shurahbil b. al-Simt to a village which was situated at a distance of seventeen or eighteen miles, and he said only two rak'ahs of prayer. I said to him (about it) and he said: I saw 'Umar observing two rak'ahs at Dhu'l-Hulaifa and I (too) said to him (about it) and he said: I am doing the same as I saw the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) doing.
question: What role does observing the actions of companions play in understanding Islamic rituals?

hadith-eng: 'Abdullah b. Dinar reported on the authority of Ibn 'Umar that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) used to observe prayer on his ride (no matter) in which direction it had its face turned. 'Abdullah b. Dinar said that Ibn 'Umar used to do like that.
question: What is the significance of the direction of the ride when performing prayers while traveling?

hadith-eng: I saw the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) delaying the sunset prayer till he would combine it with the 'Isha' when he hastened to set out on a journey.
question: What are the conditions under which a Muslim is allowed to delay and combine prayers?

hadith-eng: " His face would turn towards us."
question: What role does the physical orientation of the Prophet play in the context of delivering a hadith?

hadith-eng: The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) did not come back from the journey but by day in the forenoon, and when he arrived, he went first to the mosque, and having prayed two rak'ahs in it he sat down in it.

question: How did the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) integrate the recitation of the Qur'an into his night prayers?

hadith-eng: The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said two rak'ahs at Mina, and Abu Bakr after him, and 'Umar after Abu Bakr, and 'Uthman at the beginning of his caliphate; then 'Uthman observed four rak'ahs, and when Ibn 'Umar prayed with the Imam, he said four rak'ahs, but when he observed prayer alone, he said two rak'ahs.
question: What does Ibn 'Umar's practice of praying differently with the Imam and alone indicate about individual prayer practices?

hadith-eng: He prayed while travelling.

hadith-eng: I prayed with the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) two rak'ahs and most of them offered two rak'ahs only in Mina, while the people felt secure.

hadith-eng: 'Abdullah b. Dinar reported on the authority of Ibn 'Umar that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) used to observe prayer on his ride (no matter) in which direction it had its face turned. 'Abdullah b. Dinar said that Ibn 'Umar used to do like that.
question: What is the significance of facing a specific direction during prayer when traveling according to Islamic teachings?

hadith-eng: I asked Anas how I should turn-to the right or to the left-when I say my prayers. He said: I have very often seen the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) turning to the right.
question: What guidance can be derived from the practices of the Prophet (ﷺ) regarding the direction to turn during prayers?

hadith-eng: When the prayer commences, there is no prayer but the obligatory one.

hadith-eng: The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) did not come back from the journey but by day in the forenoon, and when he arrived, he went first to the mosque, and having prayed two rak'ahs in it he sat down in it.
question: Why is it important to visit the mosque first after returning from a journey?

hadith-eng: "Say: We believed in Allah and what was revealed to us..." verse 136 from Surah Baqara, and in the second of the two: "I believe in Allah and I bear testimony that we are Muslims" (iii. 52).
question: What is the role of reciting verses from Surah Baqara and other chapters in the dawn prayer?

hadith-eng: I asked 'A'isha about the prayer of the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ). She said: The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) would observe prayer (Nafl) in a standing position as well as in a sitting position, and when he commenced the prayer in a standing position, he bowed in this very position, and when he commenced the prayer in a sitting position, he bowed in this very position.
question: What can be learned about the Prophet's practice of prayer from his ability to pray both standing and sitting?

hadith-eng: I did not see the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) reciting (the Qur'an) in the night prayer in a sitting position, till he grew old and then he recited (it) in a sitting position, but when thirty or forty verses were left out of the Surah, he would then stand up, recite them and then bowed.
question: How does the practice of standing and bowing in prayer relate to the recitation of the Qur'an?

hadith-eng: It was narrated to me that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) had said: The prayer observed by a person sitting is half of the prayer. I came to him (ﷺ) and found him praying in a sitting position. I placed my hand on his head. He said: O 'Abdullah b. 'Amr, what is the matter with you? I said: Messenger of Allah, it has been narrated to me that you said: The prayer of a man in a sitting position is half of the prayer, whereas you are observing prayer sitting. He (the Holy Prophet) said: Yes, it is so, but I am not like anyone amongst you.
question: What are the implications of performing prayer in a sitting position on the reward or validity of the prayer?

hadith-eng: I told 'Umar b. al-Khattab that Allah had said:" You may shorten the prayer only if you fear that those who are unbelievers may afflict you" (Qur'an, iv. 101), whereas the people are now safe. He replied: I wondered about it in the same way as you wonder about it, so I asked the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) about it and he said: It is an act of charity which Allah has done to you, so accept His charity.

hadith-eng: " So whether you turn thither is Allah's face" (ii. 115).

hadith-eng: When any one of you enters the mosque, he should say:" O Allah! open for me the doors of Thy mercy" ; and when he steps out he should say: 'O Allah! I beg of Thee Thy Grace." (Imam Muslim said: I heard Yahya saying: I transcribed this hadith from the compilation of Sulaiman b. Bilal.)

hadith-eng: The Apostle of Allah (ﷺ) owed me a debt; he paid me back and made an addition (of this). I entered the mosque and he (the Holy Prophet) said to me: Observe two rak'ahs of prayer.

hadith-eng: In the morning charity is due from every bone in the body of every one of you. Every utterance of Allah's glorification is an act of charity. Every utterance of praise of Him is an act of charity, every utterance of profession of His Oneness is an act of charity, every utterance of profession of His Greatness is an act of charity, enjoining good is an act of charity, forbidding what is distreputable is an act of charity, and two rak'ahs which one prays in the forenoon will suffice.
question: How does performing two rak'ahs in the forenoon fulfill the obligation of charity for a person?

hadith-eng: My Friend (ﷺ) instructed me in three (acts), and I would never abandon them as long as I live. (And these three things are): Three fasts during every month, the forenoon prayer, and this that I should not sleep till I have observed the Witr prayer.
question: Why is it important to perform the Witr prayer before sleeping according to Islamic teachings?

hadith-eng: They are dearer to me than the whole world.

hadith-eng: " Say: We believed in Allah and what was revealed to us" and that which is found in Surah Al-i-'lmran:" Come to that word (creed) which is common between you and us" (iii. 64).

hadith-eng: I heard 'Abd al-Rahman as saying; 'Uthman led us four rak'ahs of prayer at Mina. It was reported to Abdullah b. Mas'ud and he recited:" Surely we are Allah's and to Him shall we return," and then said: I prayed with the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) at Mina two rak'ahs of prayer. I prayed along with Abu Bakr al-Siddiq two rak'ahs of prayer at Mina. I prayed along with 'Umar b. Khattab two rak'ahs of prayer at Mina. hadith-eng: Pray in your dwellings, pray in your dwellings, and then said: When it was a cold night or it was raining in a journey the Messenger of Allah (may peace he upon him) used to command the Mu'adhdhin to announce: Pray in your dwellings.

He said: I asked Ibn 'Abbas as you have asked me, and he replied that he [the Holy Prophet] wanted that no one among his Ummah should be put to [unnecessary] hardship.)

hadith-eng: A house will be built in Paradise, for anyone who prays in a day and a night twelve rak'ahs; and she added: I have never abandoned (observing them) since I heard it from the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ). hadith-eng: I prayed behind the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) at Mina, and there was the greatest number of people, and they prayed two rak'ahs on the occasion of the Farewell Pilgrimage. I said: They are engaged in glorifying Allah, offering Sunnah prayer. He said: If I had done so I would have perfected my prayer; O my nephew! I accompanied the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) on a journey, and he made no addittion to two rak'ahs, till Allah called him. I accompanied Abu Bakr and he made no addition to two rak'ahs till Allah caused him to die. I accompanied 'Umar and he made no addition to two rak'ahs till Allah caused him to die. I accompanied 'Uthman and he made no addition to two rak'ahs, till Allah caused him to die, and Allah has said:" There is a model pattern for you in the Messenger of Allah" (al-Qur'an, xxxiii. 21).

hadith-eng: When any one of you enters the mosque, he should say:" O Allah! open for me the doors of Thy mercy" ; and when he steps out he should say: 'O Allah! I beg of Thee Thy Grace." (Imam Muslim said: I heard Yahya saying: I transcribed this hadith from the compilation of Sulaiman b. Bilal.)
question: How does the practice of specific supplications upon entering and exiting the mosque reflect on a Muslim's daily routine?

hadith-eng: " As Allah pleased."
question: Why might different narrators report slight variations in the wording of the same hadith?

hadith-eng: This hadith has been transmitted by Nafi' with the same chain of narrators.
question: Why is it important to have multiple narrations of the same hadith?

hadith-eng: I asked 'A'isha about the Messenger of Allah's (ﷺ) voluntary prayers, and she replied: Before the noon prayer, he used to pray four rak'ahs in my house; then would go out and lead the people in prayer; then come in and pray two rak'ahs. He would then lead the people in the sunset prayer; then come in and pray two rak'ahs. Then he would lead the people in the 'Isha' prayer, and enter my house and pray two rak'ahs. He would pray nine rak'ahs during the night, including Witr. At night he would pray for a long time standing and for a long time sitting, and when he recited the Holy Qur'an while standing, he would bow and prostrate himself from the standing position, and when he recited while sitting, he would bow and prostrate himself from the sitting position, and when it was dawn he would pray two rak'ahs.
question: What can be learned about the Prophet Muhammad's (ﷺ) dedication to prayer from his practice of voluntary prayers?

hadith-eng: I asked 'A'isha about the prayer of the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ). She said: The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) would observe prayer (Nafl) in a standing position as well as in a sitting position, and when he commenced the prayer in a standing position, he bowed in this very position, and when he commenced the prayer in a sitting position, he bowed in this very position.
question: How does the initiation posture of a prayer affect the subsequent actions in the prayer according to Islamic teachings?

hadith-eng: I observed four rak'ahs in the noon prayer with the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) at Medina, and said two rak'ahs in the afternoon prayer at Dhu'l-Hulaifa.
question: What can be learned from the Prophet's practice of prayer regarding the flexibility of prayer rituals?

hadith-eng: I saw the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) praying (Nafl prayer) on a donkey's back while his face was turned towards Khaibar.
question: What can be learned about the flexibility of prayer positions in Islam from this incident?

hadith-eng: Ibn 'Abbas one day addressed us in the afternoon (after the afternoon prayer) till the sun disappeared and the stars appeared, and the people began to say: Prayer, prayer. A person from Banu Tamim came there. He neither slackened nor turned away, but (continued crying): Prayer, prayer. Ibn 'Abbas said: May you be deprived of your mother, do you teach me Sunnah? And then he said: I saw the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) combining the noon and afternoon prayers and the sunset and 'Isha' prayers. 'Abdullah b. Shaqiq said: Some doubt was created in my mind about it. So I came to Abu Huraira and asked him (about it) and he testified his assertion.
question: What role does the testimony of companions play in understanding and practicing the Sunnah?

hadith-eng: Abu Murra narrated on the authority of Umm Hani that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) on the day of the Conquest of Mecca observed in her house eight rak'ahs of prayer in one cloth, its opposite corners having been tied from the opposite sides.
question: What can be learned from the Prophet's actions on the day of the Conquest of Mecca regarding prayer and worship?

hadith-eng: I asked 'A'isha about the prayer of the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) during the night (i. e. Tahajjud prayer) She replied: He used to pray for a long time standing and for a long time sitting in the night, and when he recited the Qur'an while standing, he would bow himself from the standing position, and when he recited while sitting, he would bow from the sitting position.
question: How does the posture of bowing differ when reciting the Qur'an while standing versus sitting during prayer?

hadith-eng: The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) used to pray while sitting (when he grew old) and he recited in this position and when the recitation equal to thirty or forty verses was left, he would then stand up and recite (for this duration) in a standing position and then bowed himself and then prostrated himself and did the same in the second rak'ah.
question: How does this practice reflect the flexibility allowed in Islamic prayer for those with physical limitations?

hadith-eng: I saw the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) praying (Nafl prayer) on a donkey's back while his face was turned towards Khaibar.
question: What can be inferred about the flexibility of prayer positions from this narration?

hadith-eng: I asked Anas how I should turn-to the right or to the left-when I say my prayers. He said: I have very often seen the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) turning to the right.
question: What can be learned from the companions about the Prophet's (ﷺ) prayer practices?

hadith-eng: I went to the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) on the day of the Conquest of Mecca and found him taking a bath, and Fatimah, his daughter, had provided him privacy with the help of a cloth. I gave him salutation and he said: Who is she? I said: It is Umm Hani, daughter of Abu Talib. He (the Holy Prophet) said: Greeting for Umm Hani. When he had completed the bath, he stood up and observed eight rak'ahs wrapped up in one cloth. When he turned back (after the prayer), I said to him: Messenger of Allah, the son of my mother 'Ali b. Abu Talib is going to kill a person, Fulan b. Hubaira whom I have given protection. Upon this the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: We too have given protection whom you have given protection, O Umm Hani. Umm Hani said: It was the forenoon (prayer).
question: What is the significance of performing eight rak'ahs in one cloth as observed by the Prophet (ﷺ)?

hadith-eng: three fasts during every month, two rak'ahs of the forenoon prayer, and observing Witr prayer before going to bed.
question: What is the significance of observing Witr prayer before sleeping in Islam?

hadith-eng: I have never seen the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) hastening as much in observing supererogatory as two rak'ahs before the (Fard) of the dawn prayer.
question: What can be inferred about the Prophet's (ﷺ) devotion to prayer from his practice of hastening to perform two rak'ahs before the dawn prayer?

hadith-eng: "Say: We believed in Allah and what was revealed to us..." verse 136 from Surah Baqara, and in the second of the two: "I believe in Allah and I bear testimony that we are Muslims" (iii. 52).
question: What is the role of affirming faith in Allah and the testimony of being a Muslim in daily prayers?

question: What role do chain of transmitters play in the authenticity of a hadith?

hadith-eng: The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) observed the noon and afternoon prayers together in Medina without being in a state of fear or in a state of journey. He said: I asked Ibn 'Abbas as you have asked me, and he replied that he [the Holy Prophet] wanted that no one among his Ummah should be put to [unnecessary] hardship.)
question: What are the reasons behind the Prophet's decision to combine prayers in Medina without fear or travel?

hadith-eng: I asked Anas how I should turn-to the right or to the left-when I say my prayers. He said: I have very often seen the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) turning to the right.
question: What significance does turning to the right hold in Islamic prayer practices?

hadith-eng: I entered the mosque, when the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) had been sitting among people, and I also sat down among them. Upon this the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: What prevented you from offering two rak'ahs (of Nafl prayer) before sitting down? I said: Messenger of Allah, I saw you sitting and people sitting (around you and I, therefore, sat in your company). He (the Holy Prophet) then said: When anyone among you enters the mosque, he should not sit till he has observed two rak'ahs.
question: What should one do if they enter a mosque and find others already seated, according to the teachings of the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ)?

hadith-eng: Ibn 'Umar reported that Hafsa, the Mother of the Believers, informed him that when the Mu'adhdhin became silent after calling (people) to the dawn prayer, the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) commenced the dawn (prayer) when it dawned by observing two short rak'ahs before the commencement of the (Fard) prayer.
question: What can be learned about the Prophet's (ﷺ) practice regarding the dawn prayer from this narration?

hadith-eng: If any Muslim servant (of Allah) performed ablution, and performed it well, and then observed every day, the rest of the hadith is the same.
question: What are the benefits of maintaining regular prayer in a Muslim's life?

hadith-eng: I asked 'A'isha how the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) did in the two rak'ahs as he (observed them) sitting. She said: He would recite (the Qur'an) in them, and when he intended to bow, he would stand up and then bowed.
question: What is the significance of standing before bowing in prayer according to the Prophet's practice?

hadith-eng: I told 'Umar b. al-Khattab that Allah had said:" You may shorten the prayer only if you fear that those who are unbelievers may afflict you" (Qur'an, iv. 101), whereas the people are now safe. He replied: I wondered about it in the same way as you wonder about it, so I asked the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) about it and he said: It is an act of charity which Allah has done to you, so accept His charity.
question: What does the concept of divine charity mean in the context of Islamic practices?

hadith-eng: I asked Ibn 'Abbas: How should I say prayer when I am in Mecca, and when I do not pray along with the Imam? He said: Two rak'ahs (of prayer) is the Sunnah of Abu'l-Qasim (ﷺ).
question: How does the practice of performing two rak'ahs relate to the traditions of prayer in Mecca?

hadith-eng: The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said two rak'ahs at Mina, and Abu Bakr after him, and 'Umar after Abu Bakr, and 'Uthman at the beginning of his caliphate; then 'Uthman observed four rak'ahs, and when Ibn 'Umar prayed with the Imam, he said four rak'ahs, but when he observed prayer alone, he said two rak'ahs.
question: What does the variation in the number of rak'ahs performed by Ibn 'Umar indicate about following the Imam in prayer?

hadith-eng: Pray in your dwellings; and then said: When it was a cold, rainy night, the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) used to command the Mu'adhdhin to say" Pray in your dwellings."
question: What role does the Mu'adhdhin play in conveying the Prophet's guidance during challenging weather?

hadith-eng: Pray in your dwellings, pray in your dwellings, and then said: When it was a cold night or it was raining in a journey the Messenger of Allah (may peace he upon him) used to command the Mu'adhdhin to announce: Pray in your dwellings.
question: What is the significance of allowing prayer to be performed at home during challenging weather conditions?

hadith-eng: I accompanied Ibn 'Umar on the road to Mecca and he led us in two rak'ahs at the noon prayer, then he went forward and we too went along with him to a place where he alighted, and he sat and we sat along with him, and he cast a glance to the side where he said prayer and he saw people standing and asked: What are they doing? I said: They are engaged in glorifying Allah, offering Sunnah prayer. He said: If I had done so I would have perfected my prayer; O my nephew! I accompanied the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) on a journey, and he made no addittion to two rak'ahs, till Allah called him. I accompanied Abu Bakr and he made no addition to two rak'ahs till Allah caused him to die. I accompanied 'Umar and he made no addition to two rak'ahs till Allah caused him to die. I accompanied 'Uthman and he made no addition to two rak'ahs, till Allah caused him to die, and Allah has said:" There is a model pattern for you in the Messenger of Allah" (al-Qur'an, xxxiii. 21).
question: What is the importance of performing only the obligatory prayers while traveling according to the companions of the Prophet?

hadith-eng: Pray in your dwellings; and then said: When it was a cold, rainy night, the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) used to command the Mu'adhdhin to say" Pray in your dwellings."
question: What instructions are given to the Mu'adhdhin regarding the call to prayer in inclement weather?

hadith-eng: When you have announced" I testify that there is no god but Allah; I testify that Muhammad is the Messenger of Allah," do not say:" Come to the prayer," but make this announcement:" Say prayer in your houses." He (the narrator) said that the people disapproved of it. Ibn 'Abbas said: Are you astonished at it? He (the Holy Prophet), who is better than I, did it. Jumu'a prayer is no doubt obligatory, but I do not like that I should (force you) to come out and walk in mud and slippery ground.
question: What is the significance of prioritizing safety and convenience for the congregation in Islamic teachings?

hadith-eng: I saw the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) praying (Nafl prayer) on a donkey's back while his face was turned towards Khaibar.
question: What does this narration imply about the permissibility of praying while traveling or on a moving animal?

hadith-eng: A person entered the mosque, while the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) was leading the dawn prayer. When the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) had pronounced salutations (he had concluded the prayer), he said: O, so and so, which one out of these two prayers did you count (as your Fard prayer), the one that you observed alone or the prayer that you observed with us?

hadith-eng: The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) bought a camel from me. When he came back to Medina, he ordered me to come to the mosque and observed two rak'ahs of prayer.

hadith-eng: I heard 'Abd al-Rahman as saying; 'Uthman led us four rak'ahs of prayer at Mina. It was reported to Abdullah b. Mas'ud and he recited:" Surely we are Allah's and to Him shall we return," and then said: I prayed with the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) at Mina two rak'ahs of prayer. I prayed along with Abu Bakr al-Siddiq two rak'ahs of prayer at Mina. I prayed along with 'Umar b. Khattab two rak'ahs of prayer at Mina. hadith-eng: None of you should give a share to Satan out of your self. He should not deem that it is necessary for him to turn but to the right only (after prayer). I saw the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) turning to the left.
question: What can be learned from the Prophet's actions regarding flexibility in ritual practices?

hadith-eng: The dawn prayer had commenced when the Messen- ger of Allah (ﷺ) saw a person observing prayer, whereas the Mu'adhdhin had pronounced the Iqama. Upon this he (the Holy Prophet) remarked: Do you say four (rak'ahs) of Fard in the dawn prayer?

hadith-eng: My Friend (ﷺ) instructed me in three (acts), and I would never abandon them as long as I live. (And these three things are): Three fasts during every month, the forenoon prayer, and this that I should not sleep till I have observed the Witr prayer.
question: Why is the Witr prayer considered significant in a Muslim's daily prayer routine?

hadith-eng: 'A'isha reported that the Apostle (ﷺ) was not so much particular about observing supererogatory rak'ahs as in case of the two rak'ahs of the dawn prayer.

hadith-eng: The Apostle of Allah (ﷺ) said in Mina the prayer of a traveller (short prayer) ; Abu Bakr and 'Umar did the same and 'Uthmia did it for eight years or six years. I said to him: O uncle, I wish you could have said two rak'ahs (of Sunnah prayer after shorenting the Fard prayer). He said: Were I to do that, I would have completed the prayer.
question: Why might adding additional Sunnah prayers after the shortened Fard prayer be considered completing the prayer?

hadith-eng: A person entered the mosque, while the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) was leading the dawn prayer. hadith-eng: The Apostle of Allah (ﷺ) owed me a debt; he paid me back and made an addition (of this). I entered the mosque and he (the Holy Prophet) said to me: Observe two rak'ahs of prayer.

hadith-eng: The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) did not come back from the journey but by day in the forenoon, and when he arrived, he went first to the mosque, and having prayed two rak'ahs in it he sat down in it.
question: Why is it important to visit the mosque first upon returning from a journey?

hadith-eng: " Say: O unbelievers," (Qur'an, cix.) and" Say: Allah is one" (cxii.).
question: How does the recitation of certain Surahs in prayer reflect on the beliefs and practices of a Muslim?

hadith-eng: I asked 'A'isha about the prayer of the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ). question: What can be learned about the Prophet's (ﷺ) approach to prayer from his practice of standing and sitting during Nafl prayers?

hadith-eng: The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) used to recite in sitting position (while observing the Tahajjud prayer) and when he intended to bow, he would stand up and recite (for the duration in which) a man (ordinarily) recites forty verses.
question: What can be learned from the Prophet's practice of reciting forty verses before bowing in prayer?

question: What can be learned about the Prophet's prayer practices from the companions' observations?

question: What can be learned about the adaptability of Islamic practices from the Prophet's (ﷺ) actions during travel?

hadith-eng: We met Anas b. Malik as he came to Syria at a place known as 'Ain-al-Tamar and saw him observing prayer on the back of his donkey with his face turned in that direction. question: What can be learned from the companions of the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) regarding flexibility in prayer direction?

hadith-eng: I had been asking about, as I was desirous to find one among people who should inform me, whether the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) observed the forenoon prayer, but I found none to narrate that to me except Umm Hani, daughter of Abu Talib (the real sister of Hadrat 'Ali), who told me that on the day of the Conquest the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) came (to our house) after the dawn had (sufficiently) arisen. A cloth was brought and privacy was provided for him (the Holy Prophet). He took a bath and then stood up and observed eight rak'ahs. I do not know whether his Qiyam (standing posture) was longer, or bending or prostration or all of them were of equal duration. She (Umm Hani) further said: I never saw him saying this Nafl prayer prior to it or subsequently. (Al-Muradi narrated on the authority of Yunus that he made no mention of the words:" He informed me." )

He would pray nine rak'ahs during the night, including Witr. At night he would pray for a long time standing and for a long time sitting, and when he recited the Holy Qur'an while standing, he would bow and prostrate himself from the standing position, and when he recited while sitting, he would bow and prostrate himself from the sitting position, and when it was dawn he would pray two rak'ahs.

Allah, the Exalted, has said:" Verily there is a model pattern for you in the Messenger of Allah."
question: What is the significance of observing the Prophet's practices in determining religious actions during travel?

hadith-eng: I observed four rak'ahs in the noon prayer with the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) at Medina, and said two rak'ahs in the afternoon prayer at Dhu'l-Hulaifa.
question: What can be learned from the Prophet's practice of prayer regarding flexibility in prayer rituals?

hadith-eng: Ibn 'Umar reported that the Apostle (ﷺ) used to pray on (the back of) his camel in whatever direction it took him.
question: What practices did the Prophet (ﷺ) follow when praying during a journey?

hadith-eng: 'Abdullah b. 'Amir b. Rabi'a has reported on the authority of his father that he had seen the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) observing Nafl player at night on a journey on the back of his ride in whichever direction it turned its face.
question: What does this narration indicate about the Prophet's (ﷺ) dedication to voluntary prayers?

hadith-eng: Four rak'ahs, but sometimes more as he pleased.
question: Who provided the information about the Prophet's (ﷺ) practice regarding the forenoon prayer?

hadith-eng: Ibn 'Umar reported that Hafsa, the Mother of the Believers, informed him that when the Mu'adhdhin became silent after calling (people) to the dawn prayer, the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) commenced the dawn (prayer) when it dawned by observing two short rak'ahs before the commencement of the (Fard) prayer.
question: What can be learned about the timing and sequence of prayers from the Prophet's actions at dawn?

hadith-eng: Allah has prescribed the prayer by the tongue of your Apostle (ﷺ) as two rak'ahs for the traveller, four for the resident, and one in danger.
question: How does Islamic law accommodate the needs of travelers and those in danger in terms of prayer obligations?

hadith-eng: I fell ill and lbn 'Umar came to inquire after my health, and I asked him about the glorification of Allah (i. e. prayer) while travelling. Thereupon he said: I accompanied the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) on a journey but I did not see him glorifying Him, and were I to glorify (Him). I would have completed the prayer. Allah, the Exalted, has said:" Verily there is a model pattern for you in the Messenger of Allah."
question: What is the significance of observing the practices of the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) in Islamic tradition?

hadith-eng: When you have announced" I testify that there is no god but Allah; I testify that Muhammad is the Messenger of Allah," do not say:" Come to the prayer," but make this announcement:" Say prayer in your houses." He (the narrator) said that the people disapproved of it. Ibn 'Abbas said: Are you astonished at it? He (the Holy Prophet), who is better than I, did it. Jumu'a prayer is no doubt obligatory, but I do not like that I should (force you) to come out and walk in mud and slippery ground.
question: What is the significance of the flexibility in the call to prayer during challenging circumstances, as demonstrated by the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ)?

hadith-eng: The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) observed the noon and afternoon prayers together, and the sunset and Isha' prayers together without being in a state of fear or in a state of journey.
question: How does the practice of combining prayers relate to the absence of fear or travel?

hadith-eng: The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) happened to pass by a person who was busy in praying while the (Fard of the) dawn prayer had commenced. He said something to him, which we do not know what it was. When we turned back we surrounded him and said: What is it that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said to you? He replied: He (the Holy Prophet) had said to me that he perceived as if one of them was about to observe four (rak'ahs) of the dawn prayer. Qa'nabi reported that 'Abdullah b. Malik b. Buhaina narrated it on the authority of his father. (Abu'l-Husain Muslim said): His assertion that he has narrated this hadith on the authority of his father is not correct.
question: What can be inferred about the Prophet's guidance on prayer from his interaction with the person praying during the Fard of the dawn prayer?

hadith-eng: 'A'isha reported that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) used to observe two (supererogatory) rak'ahs in between the call to prayer and the Iqama of the dawn prayer.
question: What are the benefits of observing extra rak'ahs before the Fajr prayer?

hadith-eng: I accompanied Ibn 'Umar on the road to Mecca and he led us in two rak'ahs at the noon prayer, then he went forward and we too went along with him to a place where he alighted, and he sat and we sat along with him, and he cast a glance to the side where he said prayer and he saw people standing and asked: What are they doing? I said: They are engaged in glorifying Allah, offering Sunnah prayer. He said: If I had done so I would have perfected my prayer; O my nephew! I accompanied the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) on a journey, and he made no addittion to two rak'ahs, till Allah called him. I accompanied Abu Bakr and he made no addition to two rak'ahs till Allah caused him to die. I accompanied 'Umar and he made no addition to two rak'ahs till Allah caused him to die. I accompanied 'Uthman and he made no addition to two rak'ahs, till Allah caused him to die, and Allah has said:" There is a model pattern for you in the Messenger of Allah" (al-Qur'an, xxxiii. 21).
question: What is the importance of adhering to the prescribed number of rak'ahs during travel prayers according to Islamic tradition?

hadith-eng: I went along with Shurahbil b. al-Simt to a village which was situated at a distance of seventeen or eighteen miles, and he said only two rak'ahs of prayer. I said to him (about it) and he said: I saw 'Umar observing two rak'ahs at Dhu'l-Hulaifa and I (too) said to him (about it) and he said: I am doing the same as I saw the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) doing.
question: What is the importance of observing the practices of the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) as demonstrated by his companions?

hadith-eng: The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said two rak'ahs at Mina, and Abu Bakr after him, and 'Umar after Abu Bakr, and 'Uthman at the beginning of his caliphate; then 'Uthman observed four rak'ahs, and when Ibn 'Umar prayed with the Imam, he said four rak'ahs, but when he observed prayer alone, he said two rak'ahs.
question: What does this narration indicate about the flexibility in the number of rak'ahs during different leadership periods in Islamic history?

hadith-eng: He prayed while travelling.
question: What are the conditions under which a traveler may shorten or combine prayers?

hadith-eng: Pray in your dwellings, pray in your dwellings, and then said: When it was a cold night or it was raining in a journey the Messenger of Allah (may peace he upon him) used to command the Mu'adhdhin to announce: Pray in your dwellings.
question: What flexibility is provided in Islamic practice for prayer during travel or harsh weather conditions?

hadith-eng: A person entered the mosque, while the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) was leading the dawn prayer. He observed two rak'ahs in a corner of the mosque, and then joined the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) in prayer. When the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) had pronounced salutations (he had concluded the prayer), he said: O, so and so, which one out of these two prayers did you count (as your Fard prayer), the one that you observed alone or the prayer that you observed with us?
question: What can be learned about the Prophet's approach to teaching prayer etiquette from this incident?

hadith-eng: I said to 'A'isha and she made a mention of that (recorded above) about the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ).
question: What methods are used to verify the authenticity of information about the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ)?

hadith-eng: A hadith like this has been transmitted by Anas, but no mention has been made of Pilgrimage.
question: Why might different narrators report varying details in similar hadiths?

hadith-eng: He prayed while travelling.
question: What are the considerations for a Muslim when it comes to maintaining prayer obligations during travel?

hadith-eng: Ibn 'Umar reported that the Apostle (ﷺ) used to pray on (the back of) his camel in whatever direction it took him.
question: How does Islamic practice accommodate the challenges of traveling with regard to prayer?

hadith-eng: Nafi' reported that when Ibn 'Umar was in a state of hurry on a journey, he combined the sunset and 'Isha' prayers after the twilight had disappeared, and he would say that when the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) was in a state of hurry on a journey, he combined the sunset and 'Isha' prayers.
question: How does the practice of combining prayers reflect the flexibility of Islamic law during travel?

hadith-eng: The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) did not come back from the journey but by day in the forenoon, and when he arrived, he went first to the mosque, and having prayed two rak'ahs in it he sat down in it.
question: Why might the Prophet have chosen to sit in the mosque after completing his prayer upon returning from a journey?

hadith-eng: Abu Murra narrated on the authority of Umm Hani that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) on the day of the Conquest of Mecca observed in her house eight rak'ahs of prayer in one cloth, its opposite corners having been tied from the opposite sides.
question: What can be learned from the Prophet's actions during the Conquest of Mecca regarding prayer and devotion?

hadith-eng: I asked 'A'isha whether the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) observed (Nafl) sitting. She said: Yes, when the people had made him old.
question: How did the community's perception of the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) change as he aged?

hadith-eng: The prayer was prescribed as consisting of two rak'ahs, the prayer in travelling remained the same, but the prayer at the place of residence was completed. (Zuhri said he asked 'Urwa why 'A'isha said prayer in the complete form during journey, and he replied that she interpreted the matter herself as 'Uthman did.)
question: Why might there be differences in prayer practices during travel and at home in Islamic tradition?

hadith-eng: We set cut with the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) on a journey when it began to rain. Upon this he said: He who desires may pray in his dwelling.
question: What options are available for Muslims when performing prayers during inclement weather according to the teachings of the Prophet?

hadith-eng: A hadith like this that Ibn 'Abbas ordered his Mu'adhdhin (to summon people to prayer and then make announcement to say prayer in their houses) on Friday which was a rainy day, has been transmitted by 'Abdullah b. Harith. Wuhaib, however, says that he did not hear it from him.
question: What are the implications of making announcements for prayer adjustments due to weather conditions?

hadith-eng: The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) observed the noon and afternoon prayers together, and the sunset and Isha' prayers together without being in a state of fear or in a state of journey.
question: How does the practice of combining prayers relate to the concepts of fear or travel in Islamic jurisprudence?

hadith-eng: I had been asking about, as I was desirous to find one among people who should inform me, whether the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) observed the forenoon prayer, but I found none to narrate that to me except Umm Hani, daughter of Abu Talib (the real sister of Hadrat 'Ali), who told me that on the day of the Conquest the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) came (to our house) after the dawn had (sufficiently) arisen. A cloth was brought and privacy was provided for him (the Holy Prophet). He took a bath and then stood up and observed eight rak'ahs. I do not know whether his Qiyam (standing posture) was longer, or bending or prostration or all of them were of equal duration. She (Umm Hani) further said: I never saw him saying this Nafl prayer prior to it or subsequently. (Al-Muradi narrated on the authority of Yunus that he made no mention of the words:" He informed me." )
question: What can be inferred about the Prophet's prayer routine from Umm Hani's narration?

hadith-eng: The Apostle of Allah (ﷺ) said in Mina the prayer of a traveller (short prayer) ; Abu Bakr and 'Umar did the same and 'Uthmia did it for eight years or six years. Hafs (one of the narrators) said: Ibn 'Umar would also say two rak'ahs at Mina and then go to bed. I said to him: O uncle, I wish you could have said two rak'ahs (of Sunnah prayer after shorenting the Fard prayer). He said: Were I to do that, I would have completed the prayer.
question: Why did Ibn 'Umar refrain from performing additional Sunnah prayers after shortening the Fard prayer in Mina?

hadith-eng: A hadith like this that Ibn 'Abbas ordered his Mu'adhdhin (to summon people to prayer and then make announcement to say prayer in their houses) on Friday which was a rainy day, has been transmitted by 'Abdullah b. Harith. Wuhaib, however, says that he did not hear it from him.
question: What role does the Mu'adhdhin play in communicating changes in prayer arrangements?

hadith-eng: A hadith like this has been narrated by Qatada with the same chain of transmitters.
question: Why is it important to verify the chain of narrators in Islamic traditions?

hadith-eng: I went to the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) on the day of the Conquest of Mecca and found him taking a bath, and Fatimah, his daughter, had provided him privacy with the help of a cloth. I gave him salutation and he said: Who is she? I said: It is Umm Hani, daughter of Abu Talib. He (the Holy Prophet) said: Greeting for Umm Hani. When he had completed the bath, he stood up and observed eight rak'ahs wrapped up in one cloth. When he turned back (after the prayer), I said to him: Messenger of Allah, the son of my mother 'Ali b. Abu Talib is going to kill a person, Fulan b. Hubaira whom I have given protection. Upon this the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: We too have given protection whom you have given protection, O Umm Hani. Umm Hani said: It was the forenoon (prayer).
question: What can be learned about the Prophet's (ﷺ) prayer habits from this narration?

hadith-eng: " Say: O unbelievers," (Qur'an, cix.) and" Say: Allah is one" (cxii.).
question: What is the importance of reciting specific Qur'anic chapters during the dawn prayer according to Islamic tradition?

hadith-eng: I said to 'A'isha and she made a mention of that (recorded above) about the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ).
question: What role does A'isha play in the transmission of hadiths related to the Prophet's practices?

hadith-eng: 'A'isha, the wife of the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ), said that between the time when the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) finished the 'Isha' prayer which is called 'Atama by the people, he used to pray eleven rak'ahs, uttering the salutation at the end of every two rak'ahs, and observing the Witr with a single one. And when the Mu'adhdhin had finished the call (for the) dawn prayer and he saw the dawn clearly and the Mu'adhdhin had come to him, he stood up and prayed two short rak'ahs. Then he lay down on his right side till the Mu'adhdhin came to him for lqama. (This hadith has been narrated with the same chain of transmitters by Ibn Shihab, but in it no mention has been made of Iqama )
question: What was the Prophet's (ﷺ) practice after the call for the dawn prayer and before the iqama?

hadith-eng: The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) used to observe thirteen rak'ahs of the night prayer. Five out of them consisted of Witr, and he did not sit, but at the end (for salutation).
question: How did the Prophet (ﷺ) conclude his Witr prayer during the night prayer?

hadith-eng: 'A'isha reported that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) used to pray thirteen rak'ahs during the night including the two rak'ahs (Sunan) of the dawn prayer.
question: What can be learned about the Prophet's (ﷺ) practice of night prayers from this narration?

hadith-eng: The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) did not observe either in Ramadan or in other months more than eleven rak'ahs (of the night prayer). He (in the first instance) observed four rak'ahs. Ask not about their excellence and their length (i. e. these were matchless in perfection and length). He again observed four rak'ahs, and ask not about their excellence and their length. He would then observe three rak'ahs (of the Witr prayer). 'A'isha again said: I said: Messenger of Allah, do you sleep before observing the Witr prayer? He said: O 'A'isha, my eyes sleep but my heart does not sleep.
question: What can be inferred about the quality and length of the Prophet's night prayers from this narration?

hadith-eng: He observed thirteen rak'ahs (in the night prayer). He observed eight rak'ahs and would then observe Witr and then observe two rak'ahs sitting, and when he wanted to bow he stood up and then bowed down, and then observed two rak'ahs in between the Adhan and lqama of the dawn prayer.
question: What was the practice of the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) regarding prayer between the Adhan and Iqama of the dawn prayer?

hadith-eng: Abu Salama reported that he asked 'A'isha about the prayer of the Messenger of Allah (may peace he upon him) (during the night). The rest of the hadith is the same but with this exception that he (the Holy Prophet) observed nine rak'ahs including Witr.
question: What is the significance of Witr in the night prayer of the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him)?

hadith-eng: O mother, inform me about the prayer of the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ). She said: His (night prayer) in Ramadan and (during other months) was thirteen rak'ahs at night including two rak'ahs of fajr.
question: What can be learned about the Prophet's (ﷺ) night prayer routine from Aisha's narration?

hadith-eng: It is reported on the authority of 'A'isha that the prayer of Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) in the night consisted of ten rak'ahs. He observed a Witr and two rak'ahs (of Sunan) of the dawn prayer, and thus the total comes to thirteen rak'ahs.
